questionText: What is a pointer in the C language?
options: A variable that stores the value of another pointer.
A variable that stores the memory address of another variable
A special data type for storing large numbers
A special function for memory management

questionText: Which operator in C is used to get the address of a variable?
What happens when you try to dereference a null pointer (NULL)?
options: Undefined behavior will occur (e.g., a segmentation fault)
The value 0 will be returned
Changing a variable's value after it has been declared
The program will terminate correctly

questionText: Which operator is used to get the value stored at the address held by a pointer?
What does the keyword NULL mean when working with pointers?
options: The pointer points to a memory location containing the value 0
The pointer is uninitialized and contains a garbage value
The pointer explicitly does not point to any valid memory address
The pointer points to the last byte of memory

questionText: Which of the following statements about pointers are true? (Choose all that apply)
options: The size of a pointer is always equal to the size of the data type it points to
A pointer of type double* can be used to store the address of a variable of type int
A pointer must be of the same data type as the object it points to
Dereferencing an uninitialized pointer leads to undefined behavior
correctAnswers: A pointer must be of the same data type as the object it points to
Dereferencing an uninitialized pointer leads to undefined behavior

questionText: How does the & (address-of) operator differ from the * (dereference) operator?
options: Both operators perform the same function
* returns the address of a variable, while & returns the value at that address
& is used for arithmetic operations, while * is used for logical operations
& returns the address of a variable, while * returns the value at the address stored in a pointer
0x7fff5aabbcc0
The address of the pointer p itself
A random garbage value

questionText: Write a line of code to declare a pointer named ptr to type int and initialize it as a null pointer (NULL)
